name: Cacio e Pepe with Garlic Butter and Kimchi
description: Cacio e pepe is a minimalist meal that provides maximum flavour: it literally means “cheese and pepper”. Here, I’ve added a spike of garlic and kimchi for a gorgeous glow-up – and it truly is exceptional. Don’t be deceived: this quick and easy pasta dish has hidden depths that never disappoint.
keywords: 10-minute meals, 15-minute meals, Comfort food, Dinner, Easy weeknight dinners, How-to, Korean cuisine, Lunch, Make ahead meals, Meat-free, Noodle Bowls, Noodles, Pasta
recipeIngredient: 1½ tsp black peppercorns, plus extra, cracked, to serve
1 cup finely grated pecorino, plus extra to serve

recipeInstructions.text: 1.Use a mortar and pestle to grind the pepper to a coarse powder. Set aside.
2.Cook the pasta in a large saucepan of salted water for 10 minutes or until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup of the cooking water and drain the pasta.

3.Meanwhile, melt 25g of the butter in large frying pan. Add the garlic and pepper and cook for a minute or until aromatic. Add the kimchi and cook, stirring for 1 minute or until warmed through. Add the remaining butter and cook until melted. Slowly stir in the reserved pasta water. Remove from heat.
4.Add the pasta and pecorino to the pan. Toss until the sauce is thick, glossy and coats the pasta.
5.Serve immediately, sprinkled with extra pecorino and cracked pepper.
